result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)] and OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)]. The defendant was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)] and the other charge, OWI (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)] was dismissed by the court.

  • Beau J Bongard was found guilty of Operating w/ PAC (3rd) [Modifiers: Penalty - Operating While under the Influence (3rd Offense)], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Beau J Bongard in court, in custody with attorney Adam Raabe.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant seeking furlough for funeral.  State objects to motion.  State made argument.  Atty Raabe made argument.  Court will allow release from jail for attending funeral.  May leave at 11:00 am on 12/06/14 back at 3:30 pm 12/06/14.
Bail/bond hearing on December 1, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: Filed by Attorney Mark Gumz

Cases heard: 14CF158, 13CF276, 14TR1069 & 14TR1070, Defendant Beau J Bongard in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court went over the rights & elements. Defendant plead no contest to count 3 in 13CF276. Deferred Prosecution Agreement filed. Case held open for compliance of Agreement. Cts. 1&2 dismissed. Six days jail credit granted. Defendant plead no contest to ct. 2 in 14CF158. Court found defendant guilty, entered judgment, sentence: 75 days jail, commencing today at 7 p.m. Huber granted under jail rules. $2,017.00 fine, sixty days to pay fine or set up payment plan with Clerk of Courts office. 28 months driver's license revocation, 28 months IID. Complete AODA and comply with all treatment recommendations. Cts.1&3 dismissed. Traffic matters dismissed. 14TR957R reopened and dismissed. No jail credit. Case called 10 a.m., adjourned 10:25 a.m.

Defendant Beau J Bongard in court with attorney Mark J. Gumz.  Jane Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Gumz stated he will filing a motion to dismiss.  Bond remains.  New preliminary hearing set to allow time to file the motion and have matter heard.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 6, 2014 at 09:00 am.
Appointed Attorney Mark Gumz

Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 25, 2014 at 09:00 am.
